etymology.description: 目(目) (mù, "eye") + 㚔(㚔) + 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands together; twenty")/𠬜(𠬜) = gaze with eye + depiction of handcuffs
etymology.interpretation: The character 睪 combines 目(目) (mù, "eye") with a representation of handcuffs formed by 㚔(㚔) and hands 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands together") or 𠬜(𠬜), indicating the action of 'picking' with the eyes. The inclusion of an eye emphasizes gazing, tying into its etymology of 'to gaze' through visual selection, similar to the concept of choosing or selecting.
